追.definition: to chase; to pursue; to look into; to investigate; to reminisce; to recall; to court (one's beloved); to binge-watch (a TV drama); retroactively; posthumously

追亡逐北.definition: to pursue and attack a fleeing enemy

追剿.definition: to pursue and eliminate; to suppress

追劇.definition: to watch a TV series etc regularly; to binge-watch

追加.definition: to add something extra; an additional increment; addendum; to append; an additional posthumous title

追問.definition: to question closely; to investigate in detail; to examine minutely; to get to the heart of the matter

追回.definition: to recover (sth lost or stolen); to get back

追夢.definition: to chase a dream; to pursue one's dreams

追奔逐北.definition: to pursue and attack a fleeing enemy

追客.definition: avid fan who anxiously awaits new content

追尋.definition: to pursue; to track down; to search

追尋現代中國.pinyin: Zhui1 xun2 Xian4 dai4 Zhong1 guo2
追尋現代中國.definition: In Search of Modern China by Jonathan D Spence 史景遷|史景迁[Shi3 Jing3 qian1]

追尾.definition: to tailgate; to hit the car in front as a result of tailgating

追悔莫及.definition: too late for regrets (idiom); It is useless to repent after the event.

追悼.definition: to mourn; to pay last respects

追憶.definition: to recollect; to recall (past times); to look back

追懷.definition: to recall; to bring to mind; to reminisce

追捕.definition: to pursue; to be after; to hunt down

追捧.definition: to exhibit great enthusiasm for sb or sth; to embrace; favor; acclaim; adulation; high demand

追敘.definition: to recount what happened prior to events already known

追新.definition: to seek out the new (e.g. the latest tech products)

追本溯源.definition: to trace sth back to its origin

追本窮源.definition: see 追本溯源[zhui1 ben3 su4 yuan2]

追查.definition: to try to find out; to trace; to track down

追根.definition: to trace sth back to its source; to get to the bottom of sth

追根問底.definition: lit. to examine roots and inquire at the base (idiom); to get to the bottom of sth

追根尋底.definition: see 追根究底[zhui1 gen1 jiu1 di3]

追根求源.definition: to track sth to its roots

追根溯源.definition: to pursue sth back to its origins; to trace back to the source; to get to the bottom of sth

追根究底.definition: to get to the heart of the matter

追根究底兒.definition: erhua variant of 追根究底[zhui1 gen1 jiu1 di3]

追殲.definition: to pursue and kill; to wipe out

追求.definition: to pursue (a goal etc) stubbornly; to seek after; to woo

追溯.definition: lit. to go upstream; to trace sth back to; to date from

追索.definition: to demand payment; to extort; to trace; to seek; to pursue; to explore

追緝.definition: to pursue; to be after; to hunt down (the perpetrator of a crime, an escaped prisoner etc)

追繳.definition: to recover (stolen property); to pursue and force sb to give back the spoils

追薦.definition: to pray for the soul of a deceased

追討.definition: to demand payment of money owing

追記.definition: to award posthumously; to write down afterwards; retrospective account

追訴.definition: to prosecute; given leave to sue

追訴時效.definition: (law) period during which one can prosecute or sue sb (as stipulated by a statute of limitations)

追認.definition: to recognize sth after the event; posthumous recognition; to ratify; to endorse retroactively

追購.definition: to purchase in addition (an extra item)

追贈.definition: to give to the departed; to confer (a title) posthumously

追贓.definition: to order the return of stolen goods

追趕.definition: to pursue; to chase after; to accelerate; to catch up with; to overtake

追蹤.definition: to track; to trace; to follow up; (HK, Tw) to follow (on social media)

追躡.definition: to follow the trail of; to track; to trace

追逼.definition: to pursue closely; to press; to demand (payment); to extort (a concession)

追還.definition: to recover (lost property or money); to win back

追風逐電.definition: proceeding at a tremendous pace; getting on like a house on fire

追龍.definition: (slang) to inhale the vapor from heroin heated on a piece of aluminum foil; to chase the dragon
